citation.case_name: Northern Pacific R. Co. v. Slaght

html:
205 U.S. 134

27 S.Ct. 446

51 L.Ed. 742

NORTHERN PACIFIC RAILWAY COMPANY et al.
v.
ARGARET SLAGHT.

No. 153.

Argued and submitted January 11, 1907.

Decided March 11, 1907.

Messrs. Charles W. Bunn and James B. Kerr for plaintiffs in error.

No counsel for defendant in error.

Mr. Justice McKenna delivered the opinion of the court:

1

This case was submitted with No. 152, the questions being identical. On the authority of that case the judgment is affirmed.

2

Mr. Justice Brewer took no part in the decision of these cases.
html_lawbox:
205 U.S. 134 (1907)

NORTHERN PACIFIC RAILWAY COMPANY
v.
SLAGHT.

No. 153.

Supreme Court of United States.

Submitted January 11, 1907.
Decided March 11, 1907.
ERROR TO THE SUPREME COURT OF THE STATE OF WASHINGTON.

Mr. Charles W. Bunn, with whom Mr. James B. Kerr was on the brief, for plaintiff in error.[1]

No counsel appeared for defendant in error.[1]

MR. JUSTICE McKENNA delivered the opinion of the court.

THIS case was submitted with No. 152, the questions being identical. On the authority of that case the

Judgment is affirmed.

MR. JUSTICE BREWER took no part in the decision of these cases.

NOTES

[1] See abstracts of arguments in Northern Pacific Railway Company v. Slaght, ante, p. 122, argued simultaneously herewith.
